intro: Kinghamia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant native to the coastal regions of Western Australia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Proteaceae, characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh, sandy soils and arid conditions. Its flowers, which resemble small, ghostly lanterns, are pollinated by specific insects and birds. Kinghamia is also recognized for its ecological significance in supporting local biodiversity.
